ah: meheren/TheLastDodo - how can I dual boot xp/ubuntu without the option "Guided resize and use freed space", which I DO NOT see when I try to install.  XP is already installed too

Well, it's been a while since I installed Ubuntu, but I'd do this: manually resize your Windows partition. Once you've done that, you'll have some free space. Quit the installer and fire it up again. This time, it'll detect the free space and give you an option to use that for your Linux and swap partitions. Use that and your Windows installation will be untouched.
- resize the Windows partion with Gparted?
